summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from September 2019 discussing victim compensation applications for Epstein victims. The emails show FBI personnel in New York and the Victim Services Division coordinating to obtain a prosecution letter from the SDNY to support victim claims, with one agent expressing anger about 'what happened over the weekend' (likely referencing Epstein's death in August 2019).

connections.description: Communicating via email within the FBI regarding victim compensation procedures for Epstein case victims.

events.title: Epstein's death
events.description: Implied event over a weekend that caused anger, likely referring to Jeffrey Epstein's death in his jail cell on August 10, 2019.

events.title: Inquiry about victim compensation
events.description: FBI agent MS reaches out to inquire if Epstein victims can still apply for compensation since they just disclosed their abuse.

events.title: Request for prosecution letter
events.description: FBI Victim Services requests the New York Field Office to ask the SDNY for a letter stating they would have prosecuted Epstein, needed for victim compensation.

events.title: Follow-up on victim compensation
events.description: Internal FBI follow-up emails ensuring coordination on obtaining the prosecution letter for victim compensation applications.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively working with multiple Epstein victims in the New York City area on victim compensation applications in August-September 2019.
Compensation for victims required a letter from the District Attorney or U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) stating they would have prosecuted Epstein if the case had been brought timely.
An FBI agent expressed anger about 'what happened over the weekend,' which strongly implies Epstein's death in August 2019 was a significant emotional event within the investigation team.
The email chain shows internal FBI coordination between field agents and the Victim Services Division regarding post-Epstein death victim support.
